message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient had a severe anaphylactic reaction after his 2nd Tdap administration 3 years ago, which is an absolute contraindication for PCV13 vaccination. The other options are not relevant to the contraindications of PCV13 vaccination.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient had a severe anaphylactic reaction to the Tdap vaccination, which indicates a potential allergic reaction to vaccine components. PCV13 contains similar components of the Tdap vaccine and is therefore contraindicated in this patient. It is not contraindicated in patients over 65 years of age (though PPSV23 may be more appropriate for them), and there is no known contraindication related to a history of intussusception or hyperlipidemia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PCV13 is contraindicated in patients with a history of severe allergic reaction to vaccine components or a previous dose of PCV13. The patient had a severe anaphylactic reaction after his 2nd Tdap administration, which makes him ineligible for PCV13. None of the other options are correct reasons for PCV13 contraindication.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient had a severe anaphylactic reaction after his 2nd Tdap administration 3 years ago, so he should not be vaccinated with PCV13 which contains a similar component to Tdap. The other options are not related to the contraindication of PCV13.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient had a severe anaphylactic reaction after his 2nd Tdap administration 3 years ago. PCV13 contains a similar antigen, and there is a risk of cross-reactivity and potentially severe allergic reactions. Thus, this vaccine is contraindicated in individuals who have had a severe allergic reaction to any vaccine containing diphtheria toxoid. None of the other options are relevant to the contraindication of PCV13.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient had a severe anaphylactic reaction after his 2nd Tdap administration 3 years ago, which is a contraindication for administering PCV13. PCV13 is recommended for patients over the age of 65 years and those with certain underlying medical conditions, but hyperlipidemia is not a contraindication. A history of intussusception is not specifically contraindicated for PCV13.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PCV13 is contraindicated in patients who have had severe allergic reactions to any vaccine component, and this patient had a severe anaphylactic reaction after his 2nd Tdap administration 3 years ago. None of the other options listed are contraindications for PCV13.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient had a severe anaphylactic reaction after his 2nd Tdap administration 3 years ago, which indicates that he may have a potential allergy to vaccines. PCV13 is a conjugate vaccine, which uses a carrier molecule to enhance the immune response against the pneumococcal polysaccharide antigens. It is contraindicated in patients with a previous anaphylactic reaction to any vaccine component or to a previous dose of PCV13. Therefore, PPSV23 is a better option for the patient. The other options provided in the answer choices are incorrect as they do not apply to this scenario.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PCV13 is contraindicated in patients who had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose or to any vaccine component since this patient had a severe anaphylactic reaction to his 2nd Tdap administration. None of the other answer choices are relevant to the contraindication of PCV13.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. PCV13 is contraindicated in patients who have had a severe allergic reaction to any component of the vaccine, which this patient has experienced after his 2nd Tdap administration. Options (A),(B), and (D) are incorrect and unrelated to the contraindication of PCV13 vaccination.
